TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataSourceUpdateMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Determines when changes to a data-bound control property get propagated back to the corresponding data source property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a control is bound to a data source using a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> object, you can specify when an update to the data source will occur using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataSourceUpdateMode> enumeration.
When the update mode is Never, you can force the data source to be updated by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding.WriteValue%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > Even when the update mode is set to Never, the data source will be updated when the binding is first created, so at that least one update will always occur.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataSourceUpdateMode Never = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Data source is never updated. Binding is "read-only" with respect to the data source. Values entered into the control are *not* parsed, validated or re-formatted. To force the data source to be updated, use the Binding.WriteValue method.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataSourceUpdateMode OnPropertyChanged = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Data source is updated whenever the control property changes (and also updated again during validation). After validation, the value in the control property will also be re-formatted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataSourceUpdateMode OnValidation = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Data source is updated when the control property is validated, ie. during the Validating event. Typically this does not occur until the input focus leaves the control. After validation, the value in the control property will also be re-formatted. This is the default update mode.
